newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian dollar deposits quietly steady ahead of CPI.
newsitem.headline: Asian dollar deposits quietly steady ahead of CPI.

text.p: Asian dollar deposit rates were quietly steady in moderate trade on Wednesday, dealers said.
Most traders were sidelined ahead of tonight's release of the U.S. June consumer price index (CPI), May business inventories and June industrial production and capacity utilisation data.
The consumer price index for June is forcast to show an increase of 0.2 percent compared with a 0.1 percent gain in May.
May business inventories are expected to be unchanged from April's 0.3 percent rise.

Industrial production for June is expected to show a gain of 0.2 percent versus a 0.4 percent increase in May while capacity utilisation for June is expected to ease to 83.6 percent from May's 83.7 percent.

"The market was a little bit softer in the morning on some position adjustments. Some people are waiting for tonight's release of the consumer price index, business inventories, industrial production and capacity utilisation data," a local dealer said.
"Most people have squared their positions for the day, so I don't think there will be much impact," he said.
In day-to-day rates, Wednesday/Thursday eased 1/16 percentage point to 5-11/16 5-9/16 percent while Thursday/Friday and week-fixed eased 1/16 point each to a common 5-9/16 5-7/16 percent.

Among longer dates, one-month was unchanged from Tuesday's 5-5/8 5-1/2 percent, three-months unchanged at 5-3/4 5-5/8, nine-months unchanged at 5-15/16 5-13/16 and twelve-months unchanged at 6-1/16 5-15/16 percent.
